title: Electric Aviation Takes Flight: First Commercial Routes Announced
introText: Several airlines have announced the first commercial electric aircraft routes, beginning service in 2026. While limited to short-haul flights, the milestone marks aviation's first steps toward decarbonization.

content.content: United Airlines, SAS, and Air New Zealand have ordered electric aircraft for routes under 250 miles. The 19-seat planes will begin service between regional airports in 2026.
Battery density has improved enough for short flights. Heart Aerospace and Eviation lead development of certified electric aircraft. Larger aircraft using hydrogen are in development.
Aviation represents 3% of global emissions and growing. Electric regional flights are a first step toward sustainable aviation. Long-haul solutions will require sustainable aviation fuel or hydrogen.
